column5: Quit spreading Musky propaganda Lew!  ... There aint no Musky in Nippissing!!!
ASS, GAS or GRASS - NOBODY RIDES FOR FREE! As far as "Shotgun" goes... no problem, I want the back seat all to myself. zzzzzzzzzzzz

I told myself last year that it sounded like a good time, and had every intention of making it this year. Of course now I've made no plans for accommodation or a boat ride. If anyone has to cancel let me know. Perhaps I can fill in. I'm no Walleye/Pike fisherman. All I know is bass, but I have boxes of lures of all sizes and styles and a variety of rod/reel combos so I'm sure I'll have the right gear.  I'm housebroken with only minor vices. Other than my pedantic personality the occasional cigar or pipeful is perhaps my most offensive habit. I'm old enough to have learned not to try to match the young guns beer for beer. A few drinks (brews or otherwise) each night is enough for me and beer is definitely NOT a breakfast food any more.  My river fishing buddy Rob would be up for it too if there's enough room, or an extra cabin. I could probably talk him into providing some fishart as a prize. Here's an example that hangs over my computer desk here. He'd hate the lousy photography but I used the only camera that was handy.    So if anyone knows of an extra spot or two (room and/or boat) let me know. For the moment I have no commitments for that weekend and I have a very very flexible work schedule. I don't expect a free ride.  JF

If anyone has room in their vehic and wants to share gas costs, or split on my car PM me... Also if anyone has an open seat on their boat, I am good for half the cost... I would be leaving Burlington early afternoon Friday and staying till sunday/monday

Okay, here's a stupid question or three. It hadn't occurred to me there might still be cabin rentals available, and boats. I might even consider camping in a pinch. Rob's fine with camping but he's a nature boy/artist and we know how peculiar they can be, especially when they've been wading the creeks for the last 50 years all alone. Does anyone happen to know if there are any accommodations, and are the rental boats okay? I'm fine with a tiller unit. I grew up piloting them around the river beside our house. Are there any modern licencing restrictions on the little bitty boats cuz I have no kind of boat licence?  The more I think about this trip the more I like the idea, and I know Rob would really be into it, even if he does have to go in a boat. I might even entice my bil to join us but I suspect he'll be long gone to his fishing camp on Manitoulin by then. If I thought my son would join me I'd invite him, but I'm pretty sure he's still young enough, and musician enough, to think that fishing with the ole man is very uncool, although he did get a permit and borrowed a bunch of my stuff for a holiday at Huntsville last year. Who knows?  JF

Hi John...I received confirmation from Lakair yesterday that all the cabins are rented...but they do still have space in the tenting area.  Not sure about the boats...but if you do go to their site and give them a call...I'm sure they would help you out.  Good Luck
Thanks for confirming that. I'm not surprised. I'll check the camping thang.  JF
Hey Mike, I like riding in the back seat but hey if you want to switch around I'm good for that too !! Joe, Did someone say hooch, bring it on bud !!

Hey wait a minute....lets not forget to mention the guy(other mod)who caught the biggest pike in that derby and walked away with a really cool prize.....ME  Thats right folks there is a really great prize not only for the fisherperson who catches the most combined inches but also the biggest pike overall !!!!  Hope to see you all there !!!!!  Chris
Hope everyone has a good time.  I had the pleasure of being Kevin and Leslie's first guest of 2008 a couple of weeks ago.  Class A people all the way.
I didn't know that they had a tent area!!! I should have a vehicle that I can put my canoe on by then too. I may be there after all. No more hiding behind my keyboard.
you have got to be kidding me.  I booked the following week for vacation with the plan of attending! Guess I'll be missing this year. Nuts.
You can have the prize... but I think all the credit should go to the netman on that Pike! *we net a netman icon*
Got me there Glen,got to give credit where credit is do. I must admit though, it is tuff finding good help these days

Hi all fishermen\women.Brand new to this excellent board.Ive been reading all your posts about this pike derby and it sounds like a great time. Would you guys and gals mind if a newbie and his Mrs joined in on the fun. I have already spoken to Kevin about a tent site and he said it would be no problem.  A little about me and the mrs. Myself i have fished since i was 7.Im now 51.Have cottage on lake Joe and fish lake trout and smallies.Work steady nites so all my future posts and replys will be in the wee hours of the morning. Have been on numerous wilderness camping trips and consider myself as a pretty good outdoorsman.Will be having my 27th aniversary on June 27th have 2 kids 1grandson,dog and cat.  The Mrs who will be going by the name fishtale also loves the outdoors and fishing.She has been out fishing with me quite often out on lake joe and has done well.She can be pretty quick with one liners and has had me laughing lots of times. She said that this trip sounds like alot of fun.  We would be checking in on thursday and leaving on monday if all is ok.  Take care everyone and happy fishing
Welcome to the board and of course you can join in! Don't be afraid to introduce yourself when you arrive, only half of us bite and the other half have no teeth.  -Brian

ALL WILL BE MORE THAN OK   IT'S GREEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEAT (As Tony the Tiger would say).  Last year was my first time and have been anxiously awaiting this year's GTG.  Met a lot of great people last year (We'll have to see how many names I can remember).  Hope to add to that list this year.  I too will be arriving on Thursday and staying for a week.  Musky opens on Saturday June 21.
Thanks rich & slowpoke. We will see you there. Hey slowpoke , is it the women that bite and the guys have no teeth or the other way around......lol
I'm not gonna answer that one! (in public  )
The trophy for the pike tourney is in the shop getting rebuilt so that it can accomodate more winners names..I'll post a pic as soon as it is ready!!!
Gonna be good to see spawn of ed again.
The one will do I will just bring some garbage bags for liners  And I also have my watertight canoe bag, thanks for the idea Glen,
Ill be there with wife and kids, fri-monday!!

Here's a few pics from last year's GTG.  Oh well ... someone had to win it.  (Don't ask    )   Fish Fry and picnic after the pike derby.   Fantastic Prize table.  All who enter the derby end up with some nice baits.   Reminder to all who are coming, be sure to bring along a few things to jiuce up the prizes.   First annual (we hope) ONFC Friday noon shore lunch on Tombstone island.  Just one of the many highlights of our GTG - you don't want to miss it.
Hahahahahhaha!!!! It was funny then too!  G
ahh dang committed to a tourny that same Saturday... have fun folks...
Thank's a lot Spiel, I'll pay my way of course!
...with this group, i'm certain that won't be required either... if you can, go.. have fun!
Jack,there is always a spot on my boat for ya bud. Joe
....Darn right you'll pay! The standard fee of course being a cold beer at the end of the day.
My thanks to you too Joe !  Spiel ! would 2 beers get me 2 days !  Ain't it great to have friends
LOL..  thats a cheap charter... just remember... ya get what ya pay for...
wow, inflation!!
You gonna be there Jacques, I mean Raf    Joey
who knows Joey.  to quote teh great Whopper  "you know me I'm liable to show up anywhere to fish"
Well, lets hope you're liable  It would be nice to see you again bud.  Joey
... unless it's the West Arm, Whopper doesn't do too good there. The fish ignore him AND his jig there!!!

I'm coming up on Sunday (15th) and staying until the following Sunday (22nd) and I'll have Bassmastermike and Muskiestudd with me. Mike is in charge for bringing the beer and Chris and I are in charge of drinking it.
Jack you can go with Joe but if you want to catch fish you might get into my boat instead.   Art
I'll be there, not sure what days I'll be up though, sending the folks for a couple of days anyway  Jack you will not be left a shore at all, I will have my boat there this year.  Maureen
Liable to be a bit of hooch there also.Prolly want Chris in charge of that ? Joe
Hey Brian sure ill bring the beer and dont forget i got shotgun so that means Chris is sittin in the back since hes just hitchhiking or is the gas going three ways ?? LOL

I can't be there before very late Friday night. It's too bad cause last year's inaugural shore lunch looks like a winner. I'm really looking forward to being there again this year though. I haven't missed a single one since the very first. Those of you who are teeter-tottering over whether to go or not....just make it happen. You won't regret it.
Barbara and I will wait up for ya Roy. No teeter-totter here, truck is packed already!
Please be vewy vewy quiet when you come in late Friday night Roy, some of need to get up at Lew o'clock for the musky opener

The time is upon us...Lakair 2008. Who will unseat last years trophy winner (me!) in the Crayola Invitational Pike Tournament...who will end up in a picture that will live in infamy..so many questions..so many stories! June 20,21,22! Post if you're coming or post some pics and stories to entice others. If you haven't been it is a total blast with lots of comraderie, late night bonfires with musical entertainment, early morning excuses not to go fishing, huge fish fry on Saturday night and the most challenging pike tourney there is. Meet the rednecks, the admins and Lew. He's not as scary as he looks. Past hilites include, maureens incredible folding chair, Roy's experiment with power pro, BCanuck's experiment with shallow water rocks, Gerritt's fun with tea bags, Pigeon Fishers ability to make a huge mess, The Friday fish fry on tombstome island, the betting pool on  Roy's boat launch date, Marty's ability to wade narrow creeks, the effect on military strength DEET on everything plastic, nighttime walleye on Pike Bay and your best chance to get your hands on the World Famous Jumla spinners.  See you there!
ahhhh OK, I'll be there then.
Dad and I are definitely in.   Hopefully my son will make his first Canadian trip this year too.
Well you talked me into it too Rick, see you there - and prepare to hand over the trophy  Joey

My wife and I, with our our two four-legged girls, will be coming in Thursday around noon for Cabin 5.    We'll be staying until the following Thursday to engage in some musky action.   I came alone last year, as my first time, and had more than a fantastic time.   If anyone is wondering about coming up for the first time ... wonder no more.  Every one of the members there will make you feel wecome.  I know they all did for me.
....I guess I could make time to be there. Might be entertaining.
My wife Barbara and I will be there Thursday staying through Monday. Looking forward to meeting y'all again.

Yessir, it's the #1 social event of the fish'n season.  I talked to Kevin awhile back and it sounds like Fridays fishfry on Tombstone is a go  I'll be there from the 18th till the 25th.........or maybe more.  See ya'll up there.
I will be there  We are doing our family male bonding trip, Dad, Brother, and uncle..  Stop by for some darts  A few pics from last year.

Bly and I will be there Friday night....leaving right after we can drop the kids off at a friend's place on Friday afternoon.  Will be leaving on Monday morning.  Should be a blast!!!  Here are some pics taken from the docks....an amazing place to be for sure!
I dunno......    ... fish all day:         ... and party all night:     ... i just don't know if I'm up for all of that?      I may drop by for a minute or two....
I'll be making the trek... Just have to figure out my schedule to make the longest stay possible...
If Dawg is in then I will try to make it.Art ,Dawg,myPops and I will be there from the 17th to the 22nd. Joe
Fresh meat!!!          ... for the skeeters!!!
Glad I scrolled down some Glen, thought I was going to need a 2nd roll of duct tape.
You won't need any duct tape Bill... but you may wanna bring 2 Gym bags...
Ha Ha Ha . Guess I didn't see the news was out. I didn't tell on ya Bill.
Coona$$ 1: check; Coona$$ 2: check; Coona$$ 3: check;  All coona$$e$ accounted for plus a few more.  Dang, my dad is gonna love it.
hi guys i have never been , but would like to get some directions...please
If I can drag my wife back from P.E.I. in time I hope to be there Thurs to Sun. Any chance someone has a spare seat in a boat for a couple of trips.??
....I'm certain you'd never be left on the docks if'n you want to go out.   In fact I'm sure I could fit you in my boat.
Wondering if you would post a link to the Lakair site.  Thanks.
Here ya go Nancy  http://www.lakair.com
Thanks a bunch Lew.
